unit_learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate through reflection how digital writing technologies shape creative writing practice.
Plan and produce short-form digital text-based creative works in two or more technologies.
Appraise and evaluate the digital creative work of others in writing workshops
Employ industry-appropriate vocabulary and concepts in the analysis of digital creative writing and digital cultures.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Locating examples of contemporary digital creative writing
Reading of set texts for analysis and appraisal in tutorial class (online or campus).
Reading of student workshop drafts for feedback and appraisal.

assessments.description: Students will utilise two or more technologies in the writing and production of a major digital creative work, and have published these works to the web.
Contribution to discussions and workshops; practical writing tasks; peer review.
Students will utilise two or more technologies in the writing and production of a minor digital creative work, and have published these works to the web.

data.subject_search_title: ENGX8030 - Digital Creative Writing: Interactive Prose and Poetry

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: In the transition from print-based media to digital writing forms what new genres, styles, techniques, platforms and audiences emerge? This applied writing unit reflects on the dynamic relationships that exist between creative writing practice and digital cultures. Recent technological innovations not only challenge established publishing modes, but also shape 'voice' in the digital sphere. We look at voice, and the increasing breakdown of boundaries between content producer and content consumer. Students will have the opportunity to engage with web-based and other electronic media, and to develop skills that advance their digital literacy. Having collectively established a theme for the unit, an e-portfolio of individual works will be produced over the course of the session. Assessment entails both class participation and written submissions.
data.search_title: ENGX8030 - Digital Creative Writing: Interactive Prose and Poetry
